author: Special Correspondent
text:
A few currency notes were all it took to divert the attention of a businessman, who was robbed of Rs. 3.5 lakh in Kamakshipalya on Friday.

Prasad Shetty (49), a resident of Nagarbhavi and owner of an adhesive-making plant near Sunkadkatte, had gone to Vijaya Bank in Sunkadkatte to withdraw a sum of Rs. 3.5 lakh for business purposes.

He came out of the bank and was taking out his motorcycle from the parking lot when two persons on a bike approached him.

They indicated that a couple of Rs. 10 notes had fallen by his bike.

Unaware of the trap, Mr. Shetty bent down to pick up the scattered notes only to realise that the miscreants had sped away with his cash.

Mr. Shetty informed the security guards.

CCTV footage

The Kamakshipalya police have examined the CCTV footage to identify the conmen.
title: Bizman conned of Rs. 3.5 lakh
